peering_type.description: The type of the ExpressRoute Circuit Peering. Acceptable values include `AzurePrivatePeering`, `AzurePublicPeering` and `MicrosoftPeering`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

express_route_circuit_name.description: The name of the ExpressRoute Circuit in which to create the Peering.

resource_group_name.description: The name of the resource group in which to

primary_peer_address_prefix.description: A `/30` subnet for the primary link.

secondary_peer_address_prefix.description: A `/30` subnet for the secondary link.

vlan_id.description: A valid VLAN ID to establish this peering on.

shared_key.description: The shared key. Can be a maximum of 25 characters.

peer_asn.description: The Either a 16-bit or a 32-bit ASN. Can either be public or private..

microsoft_peering_config.description: A `microsoft_peering_config` block as defined below. Required when `peering_type` is set to `MicrosoftPeering`.

advertised_public_prefixes.description: A list of Advertised Public Prefixes

id.description: The Resource ID of the ExpressRoute Circuit Peering.

primary_azure_port.description: The Primary Port used by Azure for this Peering.

secondary_azure_port.description: The Secondary Port used by Azure for this Peering.

create.description: Used when creating the ExpressRoute Circuit Peering.

update.description: Used when updating the ExpressRoute Circuit Peering.

read.description: Used when retrieving the ExpressRoute Circuit Peering.

delete.description: Used when deleting the ExpressRoute Circuit Peering.
